title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of the People (Pasadena, CA)
Interview Descriptions: More of writing constructive feedback. Then face to face meeting happens to check for working in online culture. Gradually some domain knowledge is tested and lastly the process moves to Indian consultancy -Vandey
Interview Questions: How would you share about importance of your domain to someone who is not from your domain?

title: Volunteer Instructor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of the People (Atlanta, GA)
Interview Descriptions: The process is like a class room setting. I like this because this is also the platform that the university uses. There are recorded videos that help you become acclimated with the platform. If you make it pass this and become a volunteer instructor, you can always go back to the videos as reference.
Interview Questions: Do you have experience with online platforms

title: Adjunct Instructor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of the People
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was simple and straightforward, I would say it was an ideal interview. It was structured, organized, and to the point. Left feeling as if it went well.

title: Adjunct Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of the People
Interview Descriptions: Easy process. All electronic transfer of transcripts as well as the introduction to the learning system. Generally, hr is pretty prompt about answering questions and emailing the information needed to move forward in the application process.
Interview Questions: The mostly asked about credentials, availability, and working with a diverse population.

title: Adjunct Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of the People (Austin, TX) in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions: It was a pain just to go through all detail of the applications and modules and test and samples.  If you want this job you need to work hard  on the modules but it does not guarantee the jobs
Interview Questions: All web base interview with postings review and examples. Very long

title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of the People
Interview Descriptions: Interview began with an assessment of subject knowledge and teaching preference.  The second step of the interview process included taking a course on teaching which assessed teaching abilities and university knowledge.  Once the course was completed I was informed almost immediately if I was hired.
Interview Questions: How would you interact with students across the globe with varying needs and levels.

title: Adjunct Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of the People (Pasadena, CA)
Interview Descriptions: At first, the position looked good and respectable to volunteer to teach people who wanted an online Moodle education for a hundred dollars a course..  Apply online, phone interview, fill out forms, take quizzes, watch boring videos, and write essays.
Interview Questions: Look over these recent Moodle transcripts of  last year's course, pick a question that was asked and answer it. Also present a supplementary lesson. ...After looking over most of  the actual  transcripts of the Moodles for the course I was to teach , I was horrified at what a waste of time this whole course is! The nonsense that was going on. The stupidity and the waste of a real opportunity to learn. I want no part of this joke. They are even charging $100 a course to the students as well as collecting grant supports, donations, etc.

title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of the People
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was fairly straightforward. There was a main interview conducted over the phone followed by roughly two weeks of training. The training was a bit intense, but it is completely doable as long as you have at least some experience within an online classroom.

title: Part-Time Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of the People in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: Received an email that they had enough volunteers and suggested some other opportunities. About a year later reached out via email saying they were now looking for more volunteers and if I was still interested. Had a phone call. Asked for references. Provided with hiring documents shortly later. All completed within 2 weeks.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your teaching style.

title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of the People (Pasadena, CA) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: Brief phone call followed by months of nothing.   Then email contact and some very short notice "get this done in 1 week or less" online training.    The online training used Moodle course and lots of online videos.   Although this Glassdoor review makes me give a city in order to submit the review, everything was actually done online and by emails.
Interview Questions: If you were a new crayon in the crayon box, what color would you be?

title: Instructor, College Or University Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of the People (Pasadena, CA) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: Need to fill out a questionnare as part of a Phase I of interview; Phase II was a skype interview with the director of HR; General questions about teaching style and aspirations; Questions regarding past relevant experience and qualifications;
Interview Questions: What will be your philosophy of handling students from different cultures?
